agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: State Affairs TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Wednesday, March 20, 2019 PLACE: E2.014 CHAIR: Rep. Dade Phelan HB 28 Romero, Jr. | et al. Relating to the prevailing wage for work associated with public work contracts; authorizing a penalty. HB 46 Johnson, Eric Relating to the dismissal of a sworn complaint made to the Texas Ethics Commission by a vexatious complainant. HB 74 Hinojosa Relating to requiring a public employer to give notice to new employees of the ability of certain employees to participate in the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program. HB 243 Farrar Relating to the promotion of breast-feeding and the prohibition against interference with or restriction of the right to breast-feed; creating a civil action. HB 318 Howard Relating to the Internet broadcast of certain open meetings. HB 541 González, Mary Relating to the right to express breast milk. HB 982 Parker Relating to the administration of "pay for success" contracts for state agencies. HB 1232 Guillen Relating to the establishment and duties of the human trafficking prevention coordinating council. HB 1297 Davis, Sarah | et al. Relating to a restriction on the ability of an individual who has engaged in certain actions to be appointed as the executive head of, or be employed as a member of the executive staff of, a state agency. HB 1655 Hunter Relating to the availability of dates of birth under the public information law. HB 1700 Hunter Relating to public information in the possession, custody, or control of a current or former officer or employee of a governmental body; creating a criminal offense. HB 1785 Capriglione Relating to the information required to be disclosed in a registration form for lobbyists. HB 1788 Longoria Relating to certain required reports received or prepared by state agencies and other governmental entities. HB 1876 Davis, Sarah Relating to the ethics of public servants, including regulations related to certain political contributions, lobbying activities, reports, and disclosures; creating criminal offenses. HB 1877 Davis, Sarah Relating to the ethics of public servants, including regulations relating to certain contributions, expenditures, and reports, and certain authority and duties of the Texas Ethics Commission; creating a criminal offense. HB 1886 Howard Relating to the availability on the Internet of personal financial statements filed by public officials. HB 2135 Shine Relating to retainage requirements for certain public works construction projects. HB 2189 Capriglione Relating to the disclosure of certain contracting information under the public information law. HB 2191 Capriglione Relating to the public information law. HB 2192 Capriglione Relating to the assessment of litigation costs and attorney's fees in certain actions under the public information law. HB 2439 Phelan Relating to certain regulations adopted by governmental entities for the building products, materials, or methods used in the construction of residential or commercial structures. HB 2476 Guillen Relating to the operations, communications, and notice procedures of state agencies. HB 2534 Leach Relating to the prohibition on lobbying by certain elected officers. HB 2713 Burrows Relating to eliminating the fee for electronic access to certain information maintained by the secretary of state. HB 2868 Phelan Relating to the procurement of interior design services by a governmental entity. HB 2969 Sanford | et al. Relating to prohibited adverse employment action against a first responder based on mental illness. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
